clinical_study.brief_title: Intravascular Volume Assessment Using Ultrasonography in Pediatrics Renal Transplant: A Prospective Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Intravascular Volume Assessment Using Ultrasonography in Pediatrics Renal Transplant: A Prospective Cohort Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Fatma Alzahraa Mohamed Ibrahim Hassan Haggag

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed for volume assessment in pediatrics during major surgery using non-invasive tools as ultrasonography without the need of invasive techniques avoiding its complications and as a guide for fluid therapy needed for maintaining adequate hemodynamics

detailed_description.textblock: Intravascular volume assessment during surgery is important for maintaining adequate hemodynamics. Methods approved for volume assessment include the use of echocardiography to measure left ventricular end diastolic area (LVEDA), central venous pressure (CVP) and pulmonary artery diastolic pressure (PAD). LVEDA is considered the good predictor for volume status assessment. CVP and PAD are invasive can potentially subject the patient to complications. Recently study performed an ultrasound assessment of the internal jugular vein (IJV) as a useful means of volume status assessment intraoperative under general anesthesia. In the pediatric population, only few studies are carried out to assess the use of ultrasound for intravascular volume assessment. This study will evaluate use of Ultrasonography of IJV in volume assessment in pediatrics will undergo renal transplant surgery and correlate IJV diameter, cross sectional area to CVP and LVEDA.

primary_outcome.measure: Internal jugular vein diameter, cross sectional area and left ventricular end-diastolic area
primary_outcome.description: Correlation of IJV diameter and cross sectional area to LVEDA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Internal jugular vein diameter, cross sectional area and central venous pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of IJV diameter and cross sectional area to CVP.

arm_group.description: Intravascular volume assessment in 16 pediatric patients under going renal transplant surgery using ultrasonography, CVP and echocardiography

intervention.description: Intravascular volume assessment using ultrasonography, CVP and echocardiography
intervention.arm_group_label: Sixteen patients having end stage renal disease

study_pop.textblock: Sixteen consecutive pediatric patients having end stage renal disease scheduled for living related donor renal transplant surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients with end stage renal disease
- Weight between: 12 to 30 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infection at the site of CVP or generalized infection.
- IJV thrombosis
